required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Outcomes Study of the TM Humeral Stem Used in Primary, Total or Hemi Shoulder Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective and Prospective Post Market Clinical Follow-up Study of the Zimmer Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem

brief_summary.textblock: The objectives of this study are to obtain survival and outcome data on the Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem when used in primary, total or hemi shoulder arthroplasty.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objectives of this study are to obtain survival and outcome data on the Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem when used in primary, total or hemi shoulder arthroplasty. This will be done by analysis of standard scoring systems, radiographs and adverse event records. Data will be collected and analyzed to monitor pain, function, and survivorship and to confirm the performance of the Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem.
Performance will be evaluated by monitoring the frequency and incidence of adverse events as well as by assessment of the overall pain and functional performances, survivorship, health status and radiographic parameters of all enrolled study subjects who receive the Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem.
Pain and functional performance will be measured using the American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons (ASES) Shoulder Assessment and the Single Assessment Numeric Evaluation (SANE), survivorship will be based on removal or intended removal of the device, health status will be determined by evaluation of the SF-12 as well as AEs and radiographic parameters by analysis of x-rays.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Business decision was made to remove the CE mark from this product, thus prompting the closing of this study.

primary_outcome.description: Based on removal or intended removal of the device and determined using the Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.description: Measurements will be based on the American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons (ASES) Shoulder Assessment and the Single Assessment Numeric Evaluation (SANE)

arm_group.description: Patients requiring primary, total or hemi shoulder arthroplasty who receive the Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem.

intervention.description: Trabecular Metal Humeral Stem used in primary, total or hemi shoulder arthroplasty

study_pop.textblock: Each investigator will screen from his/her patients who suffer from Osteoarthritis, Rheumatoid arthritis, Post-traumatic arthritis, Ununited humeral head fracture, Irreducible 3- and 4-part proximal humeral fractures, Avascular necrosis who meet the inclusion/exclusion criteria stated in the protocol.
